verbs.description: heterosex (third-person singular simple present heterosexes, present participle heterosexing, simple past and past participle heterosexed)

examples: For example, the heterosexing of public space means that while heterosexual couples can hold hands or kiss goodbye in the street, the same behaviour from same-sex couples is likely to attract attention and sometimes verbal or physical sanctions against them.
